additionalProperty.name: Customizable Reports
additionalProperty.value: Customizable reports in telematics allow users to tailor data analysis to their specific needs, offering insights beyond standard reports. These reports can be created based on various criteria like vehicle, trip, or driver and can include detailed information on fuel usage, driving behavior and more. This flexibility enables businesses to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), track trends and make data-driven decisions for improved efficiency and safety.

additionalProperty.name: Wifi
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems are increasingly incorporating Wi-Fi to enhance connectivity and functionality. This includes using Wi-Fi for establishing local area network connections, creating vehicle hotspots and enabling over-the-air software updates. Wi-Fi also plays a role in fleet management, allowing for data transfer and remote diagnostics.

additionalProperty.name: Document Management
additionalProperty.value: Drivers can use smartphone or tablet to capture delivery photos, record notes, collect electronic signatures and more. Access to these records allows for quick investigation of claims related to overages, shortages, damages, or missed delivery windows. Documents and notes are available anytime, enabling faster processes for tasks like customer invoicing, payroll and operational reviews.

additionalProperty.name: Invoice Management
additionalProperty.value: Functionalities for generating customer invoices, managing billing and automating complex billing processes. These features aim to streamline administrative tasks, improve efficiency and ensure accurate billing for fleet-related services.

additionalProperty.name: Emergency call (SOS button)
additionalProperty.value: An SOS button in a vehicle, often linked to telematics and eCall systems, allows drivers to manually trigger an emergency call to emergency services. This feature can also be activated automatically in the event of a serious accident where airbags or seatbelt pre-tensioners are deployed. The system sends the vehicle's location and other relevant information to the emergency call center.

additionalProperty.name: Manual Turn-by-Turn Voice Guidance
additionalProperty.value: Manual turn-by-turn voice guidance is a feature where a user receives spoken instructions to navigate a route, often using a smartphone or vehicle's telematics unit. This guidance is manually initiated, meaning the user starts the navigation and the system provides step-by-step directions, including alerts for upcoming turns and deviations from the route.

additionalProperty.name: Maintenance Schedules
additionalProperty.value: Telematics enhances fleet maintenance by providing data-driven insights for scheduling and optimizing maintenance activities. By tracking vehicle data like mileage, engine hours and fuel consumption, telematics allows for more precise and proactive maintenance, leading to reduced downtime, improved efficiency and lower costs.
